intro: Casparya multangula, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and pink. The plant thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its leaves are broad and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Casparya multangula plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
